content:
FabricClient.RepairManagementClient FabricClient.RepairManagementClient Class

In this Article

Edit

Provides methods for managing repair tasks.

This class supports the Service Fabric platform; it is not meant to be called directly from your code.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class RepairManagementClientPublic NotInheritable Class RepairManagementClient

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
    Object
  • FabricClient.RepairManagementClient
    FabricClient.RepairManagementClient

Methods

  • Edit
    CancelRepairTaskAsync(String, Int64, Boolean)
    CancelRepairTaskAsync(String, Int64, Boolean)

    Requests the cancellation of the given repair task.

    public Task<long> CancelRepairTaskAsync(string repairTaskId, long version, bool requestAbort)Public Function CancelRepairTaskAsync(repairTaskId As String, version As Long, requestAbort As Boolean) As Task(Of Long)

    Parameters

    • repairTaskId
      String
      String

      The ID of the repair task to be cancelled.

    • version
      Int64
      Int64

      The current version number of the repair task. If non-zero, then the request will only succeed if this value matches the actual current value of the repair task. If zero, then no version check is performed.

    • requestAbort
      Boolean
      Boolean

      True if the repair should be stopped as soon as possible even if it has already started executing. False if the repair should be cancelled only if execution has not yet started.

    Returns

    • Task<Int64>
      Task(Of Int64)

      The new version number of the repair task.

  • Edit
    CancelRepairTaskAsync(String, Int64, Boolean, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)
    CancelRepairTaskAsync(String, Int64, Boolean, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)

    Requests the cancellation of the given repair task.

    public Task<long> CancelRepairTaskAsync(string repairTaskId, long version, bool requestAbort, TimeSpan timeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Public Function CancelRepairTaskAsync(repairTaskId As String, version As Long, requestAbort As Boolean, timeout As TimeSpan, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task(Of Long)

    Parameters

    • repairTaskId
      String
      String

      The ID of the repair task to be cancelled.

    • version
      Int64
      Int64

      The current version number of the repair task. If non-zero, then the request will only succeed if this value matches the actual current value of the repair task. If zero, then no version check is performed.

    • requestAbort
      Boolean
      Boolean

      True if the repair should be stopped as soon as possible even if it has already started executing. False if the repair should be cancelled only if execution has not yet started.

    • timeout
      TimeSpan
      TimeSpan

      The maximum amount of time Service Fabric will allow this operation to continue before returning a TimeoutException.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The optional cancellation token that the operation is observing. It can be used to send a notification that the operation should be canceled. Note that cancellation is advisory and that the operation may still be completed even if it is cancelled.

    Returns

    • Task<Int64>
      Task(Of Int64)

      The new version number of the repair task.

  • Edit
    GetRepairTaskListAsync(String, RepairTaskStateFilter, String)
    GetRepairTaskListAsync(String, RepairTaskStateFilter, String)

    Gets a list of repair tasks matching all of the given filters.

    public Task<RepairTaskList> GetRepairTaskListAsync(string taskIdFilter, RepairTaskStateFilter stateFilter, string executorFilter)Public Function GetRepairTaskListAsync(taskIdFilter As String, stateFilter As RepairTaskStateFilter, executorFilter As String) As Task(Of RepairTaskList)

    Parameters

    • taskIdFilter
      String
      String

      The repair task ID prefix to be matched. If null, no filter is applied to the task ID.

    • stateFilter
      RepairTaskStateFilter
      RepairTaskStateFilter

      A bitwise combination of state filter values that specify which task states should be included in the list.

    • executorFilter
      String
      String

      The name of the repair executor whose claimed tasks should be included in the list. If null, no filter is applied to the executor name.

    Returns

    • Task<RepairTaskList>
      Task(Of RepairTaskList)

      The list of repair tasks matching all of the given filters.

  • Edit
    UpdateRepairTaskHealthPolicyAsync(String, Int64, Nullable<Boolean>, Nullable<Boolean>)
    UpdateRepairTaskHealthPolicyAsync(String, Int64, Nullable(Of Boolean), Nullable(Of Boolean))

    Updates the health policy of the given repair task.

    public Task<long> UpdateRepairTaskHealthPolicyAsync(string repairTaskId, long version, bool ? performPreparingHealthCheck, bool ? performRestoringHealthCheck)Public Function UpdateRepairTaskHealthPolicyAsync(repairTaskId As String, version As Long, performPreparingHealthCheck As Boolean?, performRestoringHealthCheck As Boolean?) As Task(Of Long)

    Parameters

    • repairTaskId
      String
      String

      The ID of the repair task for which the health policy is to be updated.

    • version
      Int64
      Int64

      The current version number of the repair task. If non-zero, then the request will only succeed if this value matches the actual current value of the repair task. If zero, then no version check is performed.

    • performPreparingHealthCheck
      Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      A nullable boolean indicating if health check is to be performed in the Preparing stage of the repair task. Specify null for this parameter if the existing value should not be altered. Otherwise, specify the desired new value.

    • performRestoringHealthCheck
      Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      A nullable boolean indicating if health check is to be performed in the Restoring stage of the repair task. Specify null for this parameter if the existing value should not be altered. Otherwise, specify the desired new value.

    Returns

    • Task<Int64>
      Task(Of Int64)
  • Edit
    UpdateRepairTaskHealthPolicyAsync(String, Int64, Nullable<Boolean>, Nullable<Boolean>, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)

    Parameters

      String
      String

    • version
      Int64
      Int64

      The current version number of the repair task. If non-zero, then the request will only succeed if this value matches the actual current value of the repair task. If zero, then no version check is performed.

    • performPreparingHealthCheck
      Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      A nullable boolean indicating if health check is to be performed in the Preparing stage of the repair task. Specify null for this parameter if the existing value should not be altered. Else, specify the appropriate bool value.

    • performRestoringHealthCheck
      Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      A nullable boolean indicating if health check is to be performed in the Restoring stage of the repair task. Specify null for this parameter if the existing value should not be altered. Else, specify the appropriate bool value.

    • timeout
      TimeSpan
      TimeSpan

      The maximum amount of time Service Fabric will allow this operation to continue before returning a TimeoutException.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The optional cancellation token that the operation is observing. It can be used to send a notification that the operation should be canceled. Note that cancellation is advisory and that the operation may still be completed even if it is cancelled.

    Returns

    • Task<Int64>
      Task(Of Int64)

      A task representing the asynchronous operation.

Provides methods for managing repair tasks.
This class supports the Service Fabric platform; it is not meant to be called directly from your code.
